intro: Agrostis calderoniae, commonly known as the Calderón grass, is a species of grass native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It is a low-growing perennial plant that thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and moderate precipitation. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem and a subject of interest for botanical research.
